title: 1964 United States elections
text:
The 1964 United States Elections were held on November 3, and elected the members of the <a href="89th%20United%20States%20Congress">89th United States Congress</a>, as well as the <a href="1964%20United%20States%20presidential%20election">45th Presidential Election</a>. The Democratic party retained the presidency and added to their majorities in both chambers of Congress. This was the first presidential election after the ratification of the <a href="Twenty-third%20Amendment%20to%20the%20United%20States%20Constitution">23rd Amendment</a>, which granted electoral votes to <a href="Washington%2C%20D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a>
<a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democratic</a> incumbent President <a href="Lyndon%20B.%20Johnson">Lyndon B. Johnson</a> (who took office on November 22, 1963, upon the <a href="Assassination%20of%20John%20F.%20Kennedy">death</a> of his predecessor, <a href="John%20F.%20Kennedy">John F. Kennedy</a>) won a full term, defeating <a href="Republican%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Republican</a> Senator <a href="Barry%20Goldwater">Barry Goldwater</a> from Arizona. Johnson won every state except for <a href="Arizona">Arizona</a> and the <a href="Deep%20South">Deep South</a>. Johnson won 61% of the popular vote, the <a href="List%20of%20United%20States%20presidential%20elections%20by%20popular%20vote%20margin">largest share</a> of the popular vote since 1820. Goldwater won the <a href="Republican%20Party%20presidential%20primaries%2C%201964">Republican nomination</a> on the first ballot, defeating Governor <a href="William%20Scranton">William Scranton</a> of Pennsylvania and Governor <a href="Nelson%20Rockefeller">Nelson Rockefeller</a> of New York.
The Democratic Party picked up 37 seats in the <a href="United%20States%20House%20of%20Representatives">House</a> and 2 seats in the <a href="United%20States%20Senate">Senate</a>, thereby capturing <a href="veto">veto</a>-proof supermajorities in both chambers.
In the gubernatorial elections, the Republican Party won a net gain of one seat.
